thread.title: Do nothing without a plan

author: BANKER PHARES Contributing Writer
title: Do nothing without a plan
text:
Do nothing without a plan BY BANKER PHARES Contributing Writer The Daily Sentinel | 0 comments 
The second principle of personal finance is “nothing happens without a plan.” This principle is taken from the university course book, “Personal Finance — Turning Money Into Wealth,” written by Arthur J. Keown. In his book, Dr. Keown writes, “Most people spend more time planning their summer vacation than they do planning their financial future.” kAmp C646?E 2?2=JD:D 3J E96 v6?6C2= p44@F?E:?8 ~77:46 7@F?5 E92E ah A6C46?E @7 p>6C:42?D @G6C dd 92G6 ?@ C6E:C6>6?E D2G:?8D @C 2 A6?D:@?
